markdown.markdown: ## Some Useful Facts about Python Classes * You can put your classes in a .py file and import them into your other scripts. * You can put more than one class in a file. * Class names are usuall CamelCase, but not instances * When saving to a file: - If only one class, use a lower case name of the class - If more than one, use a package name, one that stands for the logical group the classes belong to ## Anatomy of a Python Class ## Privacy Users are free to access private attributes and methods, but they not shown in the help docs. ## Static Classes Static classes don't need to be instantiated. They can be used to store a collection of stand-alone helper functions as methods. Note the absence of `self` ...
